alert.note: Alert for De Kalb (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 10:03PM CDT until July 29 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following area, De Kalb. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1001 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with rain rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour moving toward areas that had previously received heavy rainfall. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... DeKalb, Sycamore, Sandwich, Genoa, Shabbona, Lake Holiday, Cortland, Hinckley, Somonauk, Kirkland, Waterman, Maple Park, Malta, Kingston, Lee and Fairdale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
